PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_DoorWindowGlazingType
PropertySetDef.Definition: Properties common to the definition of the glazing component of occurrences of IfcDoor and IfcWindow, used for thermal and lighting calculations.

PropertyDef.Name: GlassLayers
PropertyDef.Definition: Number of glass layers within the frame. E.g. "2" for double glazing.

PropertyDef.Name: GlassThickness1
PropertyDef.Definition: Thickness of the first (inner) glass layer.

PropertyDef.Name: GlassThickness2
PropertyDef.Definition: Thickness of the second (intermediate or outer) glass layer.

PropertyDef.Name: GlassThickness3
PropertyDef.Definition: Thickness of the third (outer) glass layer.

PropertyDef.Name: FillGas
PropertyDef.Definition: Name of the gas by which the gap between two glass layers is filled. It is given for information purposes only.

PropertyDef.Name: GlassColor
PropertyDef.Definition: Color (tint) selection for this glazing. It is given for information purposes only.

PropertyDef.Name: IsTempered
PropertyDef.Definition: Indication whether the glass is tempered (TRUE) or not (FALSE) .

PropertyDef.Name: IsLaminated
PropertyDef.Definition: Indication whether the glass is layered with other materials (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

PropertyDef.Name: IsCoated
PropertyDef.Definition: Indication whether the glass is coated with a material (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

PropertyDef.Name: IsWired
PropertyDef.Definition: Indication whether the glass includes a contained wire mesh to prevent break-in (TRUE) or not (FALSE)

PropertyDef.Name: VisibleLightReflectance
PropertyDef.Definition: Fraction of the visible light that is reflected by the glazing at normal incidence. It is a value without unit.

PropertyDef.Name: VisibleLightTransmittance
PropertyDef.Definition: Fraction of the visible light that passes the shading system at normal incidence. It is a value without unit.

PropertyDef.Name: SolarAbsorption
PropertyDef.Definition: (Asol) The ratio of incident solar radiation that is absorbed by a glazing system. It is the sum of the absorption distributed to the exterior (a) and to the interior (qi). Note the following equation Asol + Rsol + Tsol = 1

PropertyDef.Name: SolarReflectance
PropertyDef.Definition: (Rsol): The ratio of incident solar radiation that is reflected by a shading system (also named ρe). Note the following equation Asol + Rsol + Tsol = 1

PropertyDef.Name: SolarTransmittance
PropertyDef.Definition: (Tsol): The ratio of incident solar radiation that directly passes through a shading system (also named τe). Note the following equation Asol + Rsol + Tsol = 1

PropertyDef.Name: SolarHeatGainTransmittance
PropertyDef.Definition: (SHGC): The ratio of incident solar radiation that contributes to the heat gain of the interior, it is the solar radiation that directly passes (Tsol or τe) plus the part of the absorbed radiation that is distributed to the interior (qi). The SHGC is refered to also as g-value (g = τe + qi).

PropertyDef.Name: ShadingCoefficient
PropertyDef.Definition: (SC): The measure of the ability of a glazing to transmit solar heat, relative to that ability for 3 mm (1/8-inch) clear, double-strength, single glass. Shading coefficient is being phased out in favor of the solar heat gain coefficient (SHGC), and is approximately equal to the SHGC multiplied by 1.15. The shading coefficient is expressed as a number without units between 0 and 1.

PropertyDef.Name: ThermalTransmittanceSummer
PropertyDef.Definition: Thermal transmittance coefficient (U-Value) of a material. Summer thermal transmittance coefficient of the glazing only, often referred to as (U-value).

PropertyDef.Name: ThermalTransmittanceWinter
PropertyDef.Definition: Thermal transmittance coefficient (U-Value) of a material. Winter thermal transmittance coefficient of the glazing only, often referred to as (U-value).
